Content:: Brian Faulkner Harry West The 1974 Ulster Unionist Party leadership election took place on 22 January 1974, as a result of incumbent Brian Faulkner's resignation on 7 January 1974 because of difficulty in achieving agreement to the setting up of an all-Ireland council.[1] The election resulted in Harry West succeeding Faulkner as Leader of the UUP.[2]  This article about a political party in the United Kingdom is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This Elections in Northern Ireland related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
